page.title: 18HOME LIFE 2
page.content: Most housewives consider an electric cooker, a 'fridge, a washing machine, a colour television and a transistor radio virtually essential and many would be happy with central heating. The installation of this in an old, thick-walled flint cottage is not easy and the expense together with the running costs is discouraging. Stanhoe has no gas supply. A few households have micro-wave cookers but in general these are thought unnecessary luxuries as are dish washers. Freezers however, are common especially in the larger families, and surplus garden produce and self-picked fruit tends to fill them rather than commercial products. For entertainment, several families have video recorders but the majority prefer television in the evening. Most children have lots of toys.
